report-001.text: In 2024, SOC 2 Type II evidence expectations emphasize continuous monitoring windows of 6-12 months across security and availability controls.
FedRAMP Moderate baselines require over 300 controls and updated NIST 800-53 Rev.
Sources include SOC2.org and FedRAMP.gov guidance [SOC2.org 2024] [FedRAMP.gov 2023].

report-002.text: In California and New York, health agencies recommend retention schedules that extend to 7-10 years for certain records.

report-003.text: The SEC cybersecurity disclosure rule effective in 2023 requires public companies to report material incidents within 4 business days, according to SEC.gov releases and the Federal Register.
The implications include stronger incident triage and board reporting within 72 hours, supported by SEC.gov fact sheets and FederalRegister.gov notices.
